Job Title: Analyst Facilities Security Officer & ITSO - US

Location: McLean, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
Job Description

The Security Analyst will perform all aspects of managing day to day activities around NISPOM security and facilities programs for Intelsat US LLC. The AFSO steers the company’s personnel, facilities, operations, information, and communications security activities especially with regard to classified projects for the U.S. Department of Defense (DoD), Intelligence Community, special access programs, or other special customer programs. This role is responsible for implementing and administering all company security policies, procedures, and functions to assure compliance with applicable laws, government regulations, customer requirements and company policies. The AFSO also supports internal customers as needed in developing innovative solutions to address the company’s business needs. In addition, the AFSO oversees the maintenance, repair, support, upgrade, configuration, and security of the company’s offices and facilities. The Security Analyst will also serve as the Insider Threat Officer and be responsible of overseeing this program.

What you will do:

 Performs security tasks as indicated by the National Industrial Security Operating Manual (NISPOM), by various Director of Central Intelligence Directives (DCIDs) and by guidelines issued by other government agencies.  Maintains the administration and safeguarding of classified information for Intelsat, ensuring compliance with all appropriate protocols, investigating security incidents, and resolving any security issues.  Maintains the company’s SCI security program and SCIF functions.  Provides guidance and support to GS’s security team, to include remote Security personnel at remote company facilities.  Provides necessary liaison with the Defense Counterintelligence and Security Agency (DCSA) and customer program security offices should FSO not be available.  Assists with oversight of security programs related to company personnel, including programs to obtain new security clearances and renew existing ones.  Executes the company’s FOCI implementing procedures and acts as a deputy to GS’s Board of Managers and Government Security Committee (GS) on compliance with these procedures in the absence of the FSO.  Participates with the company’s Deputy Communications Security (COMSEC) custodian, conducting regular audits and semi-annual inventories, and maintaining the Distributed Information Security (INFOSEC) Accounting Systems.  Experience and certifications to be supportive of the company’s Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO) a significant plus. 


You will have the opportunity to:

 Maintain (DISS/NBIS) database and related files and works with support contractor for processing as needed.  Prepare and maintain various security forms (FFCL, SPP, access rosters, etc.)  Train company personnel on security awareness and security compliance, including specific training on SCA procedures, Operations Security (OPSEC), and security threats.  Perform alarm response and compliance inspections, reporting any adverse information as necessary and familiar with UL2050 monitoring requirements.  Review emails between Government Solutions and Intelsat Corporation (the "Affiliate") monthly, to ensure that there is no undue foreign control or influence from the Affiliate.  Prepare company personnel for visits requiring access to DoD classified and/or Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) facilities or data.  Perform the duties of the ISTO and manage all insider threat activities in coordination with the FSO and ISSO  Maintain up-to-date DD-254 contract and security personnel files for all GS programs.  Helps with the development of program security plans for classified proposals and contracts. when required.  Maintain and updates the company’s System Security Plans  Perform administrative tasks in support of regular GS meetings, such as providing quarterly reports of SCA agreement and Affiliated Operations Plan compliance  Act as a liaison between government customers and the company, when necessary  Provides necessary support to the FSO and Senior Management in coordination with all NISPOM requirements. 


Your required experience/skills :

 You have a Bachelors’ Degree, with at least seven (3) years of applicable experience in security clearances, government security protocols and related subjects Understanding of 32 CFR part 107  Must have a strong understanding of the requirements necessary to safeguard classified information and working with IT controlled systems.  Operational readiness on how to operate secure telephone equipment and secure fax machines and classified computer systems.  Must have strong interpersonal, oral presentation and writing skills and able to make decision promptly under pressure.  Must hold a current Top Secret/SCI security clearance with current polygraph.  This role is subject to ITAR/EAR; candidates must be a US Citizen. 


Your success in this role will look like: 

 Effective communication skills  Strong Organizational skills  Problem solving skills  Attention to detail 


How we support you: 

 Hybrid work environment offering up to two days per week work from home (for eligible positions)  Development opportunities supporting professional growth championed by our dedicated Learning & Development team. 20-25% of our positions are hired internally!  Ways to get involved: satellite launch parties, company connect events, charitable activities, team social events, recognition programs, and employee resource groups.  Wide range of benefits and perks to help you stay healthy, happy, and productive. These include paid leave programs, medical, tuition reimbursement, and retirement benefits, employee wellness offerings, and more! 


These benefits are designed to support your overall well-being and help you succeed in your role.

Our D&I Commitment

We’re committed to fostering a culture and environment of diversity, inclusion and respect – a place where everyone can show up fully as themselves and do their best work every day. We're a technology leader committed to advancing diverse, inclusive teams – where belonging is rooted in our culture. Intelsat has an established Diversity & Inclusion Council and Employee Resource Groups. Intelsat is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based upon race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, pregnancy, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by applicable law .

While it is important to note that meeting the minimum qualifications is a fundamental requirement for consideration, if you are enthusiastic about this role and are unsure how well your experience aligns with these requirements, we encourage you to apply. Our recruitment team will assess your application and determine if your skills and qualifications meet the essential criteria for this role or whether there might be another role within our organization that is a better match.

Other Job Info: 

 These statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this job. This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of employees assigned to this job.  Job requires ability to lift up to 20 lbs 


About Us

As the foundational architects of satellite technology, Intelsat applies our expertise to develop breakthrough solutions that advance and secure boundless applications for our customers and partners.

At Intelsat, we increase human potential by connecting people, communities, businesses, and governments. Our employees enjoy a casual and collaborative environment, where we celebrate professional excellence in pursuit of the corporate mission. We hire skilled professionals who work in various areas such as: satellite engineering, network operations, cloud architecture, accounting, sales, legal, and more. Browse our current job openings or create a professional profile to stay informed about opportunities that match your interests and expertise.

Intelsat is subject to regulation by certain U.S. Government national security agencies, which require that we collect and share certain Personally Identifiable Information (“PII”) with the U.S. Government to obtain permission to employ non-U.S. persons in certain roles. If selected for a role at Intelsat, we may collect and share your PII for these purposes.

 Intelsat is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer including Vets and Disabled

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
